title: Finger Decoding and Quadcopter Control iBCI Dataset
description: Dataset from a study demonstrating continuous intracortical BCI control of three finger groups and virtual quadcopter navigation in an individual with tetraplegia.
full_description: This dataset supports a high-performance intracortical BCI study in a participant with tetraplegia, enabling real-time control of three independent finger groups, including 2D thumb movements, for a total of four degrees of freedom. The participant completed target-reaching tasks at a high throughput and used decoded finger positions to control a virtual quadcopter through obstacle courses. The work emphasizes both technical advancement and user-centered goals such as recreation and social participation. Data includes finger kinematics, target tracking, neural features, and performance metrics.
data_format: Likely MATLAB or CSV (not explicitly specified)
citation: Willsey M. S., Shah N. P., Avansino D. T., et al. (2025). A high-performance brain–computer interface for finger decoding and quadcopter game control in an individual with paralysis. Nature Medicine, 31, 96–104.
